page.title: 16FUTURE DEVELOPMENT
page.content: I went to Woking Borough Council Offices.There I talked to a lady called Mrs Vail.We found out that the Council Offices were opened on June 9 1983.She showed the plans for the future development in our local area.We particularly looked at one road which will go in front of my house.This is called the St Johns Relief Road.It is designed to relieve St Johns of all the heavy traffic.We also saw the plans for Brookwood Lye but these have got to be finalised.A development company wants to build a factory there,but there is alot of argument about this.Part of Brookwood Hospital is going to be knocked down and a Marina built as well as more shops.Some land is being reserved for building in 1991 and some for leisure. I wonder if all these things will happen. (SARAH BROWN. Age 10)
